Line 7: Line 7:
The issue of limiting presidential powers was postponed until after the elections as part of the new constitution drafting process.<ref>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12589425</ref>
The issue of limiting presidential powers was postponed until after the elections as part of the new constitution drafting process.<ref>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12589425</ref>
â
==The old constitution==
+
==The Old Constitution==
â
# Article 76 of the [[Constitution of Egypt]] states: '''"The People's Assembly shall nominate the President of the Republic . The nomination shall be referred to the people for a plebiscite. The nomination for the President of the Republic shall be made in the Peopleâ Assembly upon the proposal of at least one third of its members. The candidate who obtains two thirds of the votes of the members of the People's Assembly shall be referred to the people for a plebiscite . If he does not obtain the said majority the nomination process shall be repeated two days after the first vote. The candidate obtaining an absolute majority of the votes of the Assembly members shall be referred to the citizens for a plebiscite. The candidate shall be considered President of the Republic when he obtains an absolute majority of votes cast in the plebiscite. If the candidate does not obtain this majority, the Assembly shall propose the nomination of another candidate and the same procedure shall follow concerning his candidature and election."'''<ref name="Chapter five: The Government, Part One: The Head of the State">{{cite web|url=http://www.egypt.gov.eg/english/laws/Constitution/chp_five/part_one.aspx |title=Chapter five: The Government, Part One: The Head of the State |publisher=Egypt.gov.eg |date= |accessdate=October 19, 2010}}</ref>.
+
# Article 75 of the Constitution of Egypt states: '''"".
â
# Article 77 of the [[Constitution of Egypt]] that states: '''"The term of the presidency shall be six [[Gregorian Calendar|Gregorian years]] starting from the date of the announcement of result of the plebiscite. The President of the Republic may be re-elected for other successive terms."'''<ref name="Chapter five: The Government, Part One: The Head of the State"/>.
+
# Article 76 of the Constitution of Egypt states: '''"The People's Assembly shall nominate the President of the Republic . The nomination shall be referred to the people for a plebiscite. The nomination for the President of the Republic shall be made in the Peopleâ Assembly upon the proposal of at least one third of its members. The candidate who obtains two thirds of the votes of the members of the People's Assembly shall be referred to the people for a plebiscite . If he does not obtain the said majority the nomination process shall be repeated two days after the first vote. The candidate obtaining an absolute majority of the votes of the Assembly members shall be referred to the citizens for a plebiscite. The candidate shall be considered President of the Republic when he obtains an absolute majority of votes cast in the plebiscite. If the candidate does not obtain this majority, the Assembly shall propose the nomination of another candidate and the same procedure shall follow concerning his candidature and election."'''<ref name="Chapter five: The Government, Part One: The Head of the State">{{cite web|url=http://www.egypt.gov.eg/english/laws/Constitution/chp_five/part_one.aspx |title=Chapter five: The Government, Part One: The Head of the State |publisher=Egypt.gov.eg |date= |accessdate=October 19, 2010}}</ref>.
â
# Article 88 of the [[Constitution of Egypt]] that states: '''"The Law shall determine the conditions which members of the Assembly must fulfil as well as the rules of election and referendum, while the ballot shall be conducted under the supervision of the members of a judiciary organ."'''<ref name="Chapter five: The Government, Part Two: The People's Assembly">{{cite web|url=http://www.egypt.gov.eg/english/laws/Constitution/chp_five/part_two.aspx |title=Chapter five: The Government, Part Two: The People's Assembly |publisher=Egypt.gov.eg |date= |accessdate=October 19, 2010}}</ref>.
+
# Article 77 of the Constitution of Egypt that states: '''"The term of the presidency shall be six [[Gregorian Calendar|Gregorian years]] starting from the date of the announcement of result of the plebiscite. The President of the Republic may be re-elected for other successive terms."'''<ref name="Chapter five: The Government, Part One: The Head of the State"/>.
